headline: NFL Playoffs: Why is it called a safety?
author: MARCA ENGLISH
sentences:
Two types of safety positions
Since the introduction of the forward pass in football, offenses started to spread out to throwing the football as their primary strategy.

The safety position is, according to defense coaches, one of the most important positions in football.
Also, the free safety practices and specializes in tackling players in the open field.
Strong safeties have the responsibility to tackle running backs and cover receivers.
Safeties are physically bigger than cornerbacks but much smaller than linebackers.
Football coaches put their most athletic and best tackler at the safety position.
Meanwhile, free safeties responsibilities are more varied and cover more ground.
The main assignment of free safety is to cover the middle of the field.

Free Safety
the most common safety position in defensive structures.
Football defenses needed to match the aerial attack by adding speed.
They need more muscular body mass because they guard specific gaps.

Strong Safety
Strong safeties have a linebacker physical complex.
They guard a 20 yard or more perimeter from offensive players.
NFL teams hire a Safety to stop the big plays from happening.
It is occupied by a player that can cover the ground.
It is a position that requires speed and athletism.
The safety position has two types of variations.
Nevertheless, they need a high-speed game.
